description: The overflow: overlay CSS declaration is an alias to overflow: auto. Historically, it caused non-standard behavior, allowing scrollbars to overlay content without taking up layout space.
description_html: The overflow: overlay CSS declaration is an alias to overflow: auto. Historically, it caused non-standard behavior, allowing scrollbars to overlay content without taking up layout space.
name: overflow: overlay

chrome.notes: Before version 114, the overlay keyword caused non-standard behavior, allowing scrollbars to overlay content without taking up layout space. From version 114, the keyword aliases to the standard auto keyword. See bug 40444262.
